name: MaskTool
author: Nipype (interface)
description:
MaskTool, as implemented in Nipype (module: nipype.interfaces.afni, interface: MaskTool).
3dmask_tool - for combining/dilating/eroding/filling masks
For complete details, see the `3dmask_tool Documentation. <https://afni.nimh.nih.gov/pub../pub/dist/doc/program_help/3dmask_tool.html>`_

inputs.name: Args
inputs.description: A string. Additional parameters to the command.

inputs.name: Count
inputs.description: A boolean. Instead of created a binary 0/1 mask dataset, create one with counts of voxel overlap, i.e., each voxel will contain the number of masks that it is set in.

inputs.name: Datum
inputs.description: 'byte' or 'short' or 'float'. Specify data type for output.

inputs.name: Dilate inputs
inputs.description: A string. Use this option to dilate and/or erode datasets as they are read. ex. '5 -5' to dilate and erode 5 times.

inputs.name: Dilate results
inputs.description: A string. Dilate and/or erode combined mask at the given levels.

inputs.name: Fill dirs
inputs.description: A string. Fill holes only in the given directions. this option is for use with -fill holes. should be a single string that specifies 1-3 of the axes using {x,y,z} labels (i.e. dataset axis order), or using the labels in {r,l,a,p,i,s}.

inputs.name: Fill holes
inputs.description: A boolean. This option can be used to fill holes in the resulting mask, i.e. after all other processing has been done.

inputs.name: Frac
inputs.description: A float. When combining masks (across datasets and sub-bricks), use this option to restrict the result to a certain fraction of the set of volumes.

inputs.name: In file
inputs.description: A list of items which are a pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Input file or files to 3dmask_tool.

inputs.name: Num threads
inputs.description: An integer. Set number of threads.

inputs.name: Verbose
inputs.description: An integer. Specify verbosity level, for 0 to 3.

output-files.name: Out file
output-files.description: A pathlike object or string representing a file. Output image file name.

output-files.name: Out file
output-files.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Mask file.
